intro: Euphrasia variabilis, commonly known as the variable eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia variabilis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
